<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/02/the-stock-market-went-gangbusters-in-2021-what-will-next-year-bring?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Your Stock Market 2021 Rewind
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/02/the-stock-market-went-gangbusters-in-2021-what-will-next-year-bring?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of the wall street bull wearing tie-dye, pink sunglasses, and a peace sign necklace in front of a turquoise background" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f96c5b53b52fd8ff2455212a82acb10169b83442-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The 2021 stock market was bookended by meme stock mania in January and a brief Omicron scare in November and December. But in between, it was a remarkably smooth ride despite, you know, C***d.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The winners</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you followed Warren Buffett’s advice and put your money in an S&P 500 index fund, you did very well for yourself last year. The broad index <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/31/stocks-could-ride-the-2021-tailwind-into-the-new-year-but-the-jobs-report-and-fed-will-in-focus.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gained 27%</a> in 2021 and closed at a record 70 times—the most since 1995.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">The top-performing S&P sectors: </strong></span><span>Energy, whose 48% annual gain was its best ever (thank you, soaring oil prices). Real estate was the second-best performing sector at 42%, while tech and financials both rose 33%.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">The biggest winner</strong></span><span> in the S&P was Devon Energy, which </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/e510d763-3864-421c-ba32-8653152c01c6?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gained nearly 190%</a></span><span>. Ford, Moderna, and nine others in the index more than doubled their stock price.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So where are all the Big Tech names? They had a great but not <em>amazing </em>year. Microsoft rose 51%, and Apple’s 34% gain has it sitting close to a $3 trillion market capitalization. And by virtue of their immense size, Big Tech stocks were the top six contributors to the S&P’s performance.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The losers</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Smaller, high-growth tech stocks faltered—just look at the Ark Innovation ETF, which declined 24% after shooting up 150% the year before. That fund is home to companies like Roku, Twitter, DraftKings, and Palantir.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many “stay-at-home” stocks that boomed at the onset of the pandemic also fell back to Earth. Zoom lost nearly half of its value in 2021, and Peloton plunged more than 75%. 2021 IPOs stumbled, too: A fund that tracks public offerings fell more than 9% for its worst performance in three years.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What about next year?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Analysts see both opportunities and headwinds for the stock market in 2022. Most forecasters expect stocks to continue their upward march after corporations posted <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/cheaper-stocks-boost-s-p-500s-prospects-in-new-year-11641059747?mod=rss_markets_main" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record profit growth</a> in 2021 of 45%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But analysts don’t expect stocks to surge as much as they did last year, in part because the Fed is withdrawing its pandemic-era support to curb the highest inflation in nearly four decades. The central bank is expected to wind down its stimulus measures this quarter and begin to hike rates for the first time since 2018.</p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/02/us-considering-adding-testing-requirement-to-shortened-isolation-period-says-fauci?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Testing 1...2...3...4...5...
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/02/us-considering-adding-testing-requirement-to-shortened-isolation-period-says-fauci?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Dr. Fauci" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/4838386029bb7cb5b7425030a84233899f909869-5088x3392.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Dec. 27, the CDC reduced the required isolation time for people who tested positive for Covid but weren’t showing any symptoms from 10 days to five. Now, it’s <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-health-united-states-anthony-fauci-centers-for-disease-control-and-prevention-5f3e45e2f140f94df02267e22c307664?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reconsidering</a> one of the most controversial aspects of this new rule.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dr. Fauci said yesterday that health officials are looking at adding a negative test requirement after five days of quarantine. Under existing guidance, you can emerge from isolation without showing a negative test.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>According to the CDC, that’s because PCR tests could potentially show a positive reading for up to 12 weeks. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Meanwhile, rapid tests aren’t designed to indicate whether you’re contagious or not.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The reduced isolation time is intended to prevent mass societal disruptions caused by quarantining workers—for instance, at least 13,000 flights have been canceled since Christmas Eve, in part due to Omicron-induced staffing issues. But the new, looser guidelines from the CDC have been met with considerable pushback for not putting public health first.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>on Sunday Fauci predicted that updated testing rules from the CDC could come within “the next day or so.”</p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/02/twitter-permanently-bans-marjorie-taylor-greene-s-personal-account?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Twitter Bans @mtgreenee
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/02/twitter-permanently-bans-marjorie-taylor-greene-s-personal-account?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Marjorie Taylor Greene " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/6ef29e0594cd14c9ce7b0d26d88ddaa81bada22e-4971x3314.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Sean Rayford/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Twitter has <a href="https://www.axios.com/twitter-permanently-suspends-marjorie-taylor-greene-98b24ac2-9932-4766-83a7-7d947889228f.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">permanently suspended</a> the personal account of Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) for repeatedly violating its Covid-19 misinformation policy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Greene's account was banned after her Saturday tweets about vaccines, including one that read, “Before Covid, Reported deaths from vaccines were taken seriously and dangerous vaccines were stopped. After Covid, Extremely high amounts of covid vaccine deaths are ignored…”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Under Twitter’s rules, which are intended to root out Covid-19 misinformation that could harm people, Greene’s post was her personal account’s <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/02/technology/marjorie-taylor-greene-twitter.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fifth “strike,”</a> which means permanent suspension. Her first four strikes came for other false or misleading statements about Covid, like her claim in August that vaccines were “failing,” despite overwhelming evidence that they are effective at preventing severe illness and death.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In response to her Twitter suspension, Greene said that “Twitter is an enemy to America and can’t handle the truth.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Greene’s congressional account, @RepMTG, is still active.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Despite outcry from conservatives, Twitter has not hesitated to ban high-profile politicians for what it deems dangerous posts. Nearly one year ago, it booted former President Trump over the risk of “further incitement of violence” following the Jan. 6 insurrection.</p>
</div>

<img alt="Betty White" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/8a3f0212ecf6af244d93d4b1e565bd9c93b24220-4673x3147.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Amanda Edwards/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>TV legend Betty White died Friday, just weeks before her 100th birthday on January 17. Want to get a sense of how long she lived? Babe Ruth hit <a href="https://calltothepen.com/2021/12/31/crazy-statistic-betty-white-babe-ruth/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">552 home runs</a> after White was born.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “He is no longer a Buc.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tampa Bay Buccaneers head coach Bruce Arians announced that wide receiver Antonio Brown would not be a part of the team moving forward. Brown pulled off the most <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/nfl/buccaneers/2022/01/02/antonio-brown-removes-uniform-leaves-tampa-bay-buccaneers/9072790002/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bizarre move</a> of this (or any?) NFL season when he stripped off his pads and shirt in the middle of Sunday’s game vs. the Jets and walked off the field. He had just returned from a 3-game suspension for using a fake Covid vaccine card.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>How will the history books remember 2021? (<a href="https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2021/12/29/how-will-the-history-books-remember-2021-526219?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Politico</a>)</p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/02/the-week-ahead-january-3?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
The Week Ahead
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2022 will not be offering a gradual onboarding experience; the first week of the year is going to smack us all in the face.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">January 6 anniversary: </strong>House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has lined up a <a href="https://thehill.com/homenews/house/587792-historians-jon-meacham-doris-kearns-goodwin-to-speak-at-house-event-on-jan-6?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">series of events</a>—including a moment of silence and a conversation with historians—to mark one year since the storming of the Capitol building.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jobs report: </strong>The December jobs report drops on Friday, and with it we’ll get a full picture of the labor market’s big rebound in 2021. Economists expect that 405,000 jobs were added last month, and that the unemployment rate dropped to 4.1% from 4.2%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The 5G battle reaches a climax: </strong>Verizon and AT&T will roll out their new 5G services on Wednesday. Airlines had requested a <a href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/airlines-ask-fcc-to-again-delay-c-band-5g-rollout-near-airports-beyond-jan-5/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delay</a>, arguing that these wireless signals will interrupt flight operations near airports, but telecom companies are refusing to postpone the launch. Instead, they're offering to dim the power of the service for the first six months.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>CES, one of the leading consumer electronics shows, will begin in-person in Las Vegas on Wednesday, but without many notable attendees.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The jury for Elizabeth Holmes’s fraud case will pick up deliberations today, having been unable to reach a decision in six previous days of talks.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The 26th season of </span><span><em>The Bachelor</em></span><span> premieres tonight.</span>
</li>
</ul>
</div>

by meme stock mania in January and a brief Omicron scare in November and December. But in between, it was a remarkably smooth ride despite, you know, C***d.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe winners\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you followed Warren Buffett’s advice and put your money in an S\u0026P 500 index fund, you did very well for yourself last year. The broad index \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/31/stocks-could-ride-the-2021-tailwind-into-the-new-year-but-the-jobs-report-and-fed-will-in-focus.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egained 27%\u003c/a\u003e in 2021 and closed at a record 70 times—the most since 1995.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe top-performing S\u0026P sectors: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEnergy, whose 48% annual gain was its best ever (thank you, soaring oil prices). Real estate was the second-best performing sector at 42%, while tech and financials both rose 33%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe biggest winner\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the S\u0026P was Devon Energy, which \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/e510d763-3864-421c-ba32-8653152c01c6?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egained nearly 190%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Ford, Moderna, and nine others in the index more than doubled their stock price.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo where are all the Big Tech names? They had a great but not \u003cem\u003eamazing \u003c/em\u003eyear. Microsoft rose 51%, and Apple’s 34% gain has it sitting close to a $3 trillion market capitalization. And by virtue of their immense size, Big Tech stocks were the top six contributors to the S\u0026P’s performance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe losers\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSmaller, high-growth tech stocks faltered—just look at the Ark Innovation ETF, which declined 24% after shooting up 150% the year before. That fund is home to companies like Roku, Twitter, DraftKings, and Palantir.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany “stay-at-home” stocks that boomed at the onset of the pandemic also fell back to Earth. Zoom lost nearly half of its value in 2021, and Peloton plunged more than 75%. 2021 IPOs stumbled, too: A fund that tracks public offerings fell more than 9% for its worst performance in three years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat about next year?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnalysts see both opportunities and headwinds for the stock market in 2022. Most forecasters expect stocks to continue their upward march after corporations posted \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/cheaper-stocks-boost-s-p-500s-prospects-in-new-year-11641059747?mod=rss_markets_main\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord profit growth\u003c/a\u003e in 2021 of 45%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut analysts don’t expect stocks to surge as much as they did last year, in part because the Fed is withdrawing its pandemic-era support to curb the highest inflation in nearly four decades. The central bank is expected to wind down its stimulus measures this quarter and begin to hike rates for the first time since 2018.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Dec. 27, the CDC reduced the required isolation time for people who tested positive for Covid but weren’t showing any symptoms from 10 days to five. Now, it’s \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-health-united-states-anthony-fauci-centers-for-disease-control-and-prevention-5f3e45e2f140f94df02267e22c307664?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereconsidering\u003c/a\u003e one of the most controversial aspects of this new rule.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDr. Fauci said yesterday that health officials are looking at adding a negative test requirement after five days of quarantine. Under existing guidance, you can emerge from isolation without showing a negative test.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAccording to the CDC, that’s because PCR tests could potentially show a positive reading for up to 12 weeks. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMeanwhile, rapid tests aren’t designed to indicate whether you’re contagious or not.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe reduced isolation time is intended to prevent mass societal disruptions caused by quarantining workers—for instance, at least 13,000 flights have been canceled since Christmas Eve, in part due to Omicron-induced staffing issues. But the new, looser guidelines from the CDC have been met with considerable pushback for not putting public health first.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eon Sunday Fauci predicted that updated testing rules from the CDC could come within “the next day or so.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epermanently suspended\u003c/a\u003e the personal account of Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) for repeatedly violating its Covid-19 misinformation policy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGreene's account was banned after her Saturday tweets about vaccines, including one that read, “Before Covid, Reported deaths from vaccines were taken seriously and dangerous vaccines were stopped. After Covid, Extremely high amounts of covid vaccine deaths are ignored…”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnder Twitter’s rules, which are intended to root out Covid-19 misinformation that could harm people, Greene’s post was her personal account’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/02/technology/marjorie-taylor-greene-twitter.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efifth “strike,”\u003c/a\u003e which means permanent suspension. Her first four strikes came for other false or misleading statements about Covid, like her claim in August that vaccines were “failing,” despite overwhelming evidence that they are effective at preventing severe illness and death.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn response to her Twitter suspension, Greene said that “Twitter is an enemy to America and can’t handle the truth.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGreene’s congressional account, @RepMTG, is still active.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite outcry from conservatives, Twitter has not hesitated to ban high-profile politicians for what it deems dangerous posts. Nearly one year ago, it booted former President Trump over the risk of “further incitement of violence” following the Jan. 6 insurrection.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
